Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: tal27
Reviews.Content: I dithered about different hotels for our first trip to Madrid. I wanted one with a pool, and was weighing up Urban, Wellington and this one. So glad we went for this. Price was fantastic at about 100 euros a night. We got a quiet room (I imagine most are), which was a good size with the kitchenette and a view over the pool. Bed was comfortable, a/c worked well, We usually walked into town - it was about 30 minutes to Puerta Del Sol along some lovely roads, and about 15 minutes walk to the large park. Very safe neighbourhood. Two streets over is the main luxury shopping street, and it is an easy trip to the airport on the metro with only one change from Colon (and only 5 euros per person one way). Metro was very easy to get around Madrid, with two stations close by. There is a small Carrefour on the next street so you can get breakfast supplies, and the pool area was nice - it does not get sun being in the middle of high buildings, but is well maintained and relaxing. Reception staff were all friendly and helpful, and housekeeping was very good. I agree sometimes there is a small "drain-y" smell in the bathroom, but they do all they can with what they have, and it usually clears quickly. I would definitely return. On food, like the other reviewers we ate at Bar Tomate and it was our favourite place over 4 nights in Madrid. We also liked Metro Bistro although this is a little far from the hotel really (we caught the metro there). We also ate at Botin (so you can say you ate at the oldest restaurant in the world) and whilst the service was good, it was like joining a coach group - ship in ship out, with substandard food. I would not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: joy2bp
Reviews.Content: We stayed in early August for 3 nights. We (3 adults and 1 child) booked 2 rooms, including one (of two only; rm 602) with a balcony. Both rooms (the other opposite rm 602) were clean (but see later) and well furnished. There is "not a scenic view" as such from the balcony room but it was where we all congregated to watch the Olympics and basically enjoy the cool air and have breakfast/drinks. We did not cook (there are hobs in the rooms) but did use the microwave to heat up some food. Everything worked; the free wi-fi and pool were the main reasons for picking this hotel. The location is very good. Easy to get bus to town centre, tourist info centre. A 15 minute walk away are Prada, LV Gucci, El Cortes supermarket, little cafes and other lovely shops. Also, short walk to get the hop-on-hop-off tourist bus. If you fancy the Hard Rock Cafe (go by 7 pm otherwise be prepared for a long wait!) this is less than 10 minutes walk away. ALL the members of staff we met were very pleasant and helpful; the bartenders make good mojitos and the prices were less than cafes in Plaza Mayor. We did not have breakfast in the hotel. This is served in the small area before you step out to the pool area. BTW, you will not be able to resist pressing the button to start the "metal sculpture" each time you go by. The pool is tiny and the water was not warm as it is surrounded by tall buildings. This did not stop my lot jumping in! Taxi from airport cost under 25 euros. Well worth it with luggage and the heat! Being picky now - we requested non-smoking rooms. The balcony room was a smoking room but did not stink of smoke. The ash tray on the balcony had not been emptied. All in all, highly recommended hotel. Prefer staying in a small hotel. We enjoyed our stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Super”
Reviews.Author: wafinka
Reviews.Content: Were very fortunate to arrive on the shift of one of the best receptionist I have ever come across (I am sorry cant remember the name). He made our stay so much easier; not that it is difficult to be in Madrid. Location was quite good. Rooms and hotel very clean. It is also very safe as most of Madrid. It is next door to the ministry of interior so you can walk back to the hotel safely at all hours..

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in good area - added extra an outdoor pool”
Reviews.Author: ASG
Reviews.Content: The hotel was chosen for its great location and because it has a pool: a huge plus in July. We would definitely go back for both these reasons and also because of the general level of comfort and excellent staff. Our room (403) looked out onto the street but was well soundproofed. It had a mini kitchen hidden in a cupboard and a pull out table to eat at. We were travelling for business so the free wifi was very welcome. The only small problem was that the bed was squeaking loudly. We mentioned it after the second night and were immediately moved to another room. The maintenance staff went straight to the room to repair the bed, so it wasn't just left for the next guest. The area is very quiet but right in the centre of town and perfect for shopping and eating out. The metro is very close, as is the train to the airport. It takes about 20/25 mins on the C1 from Recoletos directly to Terminal 4. Next time we will ask for a balcony room, but they only have two and they get booked very fast.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good experience”
Reviews.Author: 55711Spaingirl
Reviews.Content: I had a difficult time at this hotel, for various reason. First, the ambiance is very strange. There seems to never be anyone in the lobby, hallways, or anywhere else. There is no restaurant, which I don't like. The breakfast was average, and had several items, but very small compared to a normal hotel (like an NH) and moreover, looked like items had been carried over from day to day. Moreover, you had to find someone to give you some coffee, and servers were not friendly nor ever offered to give you anything. The tables for eating were very uncomfortable, like cocktail tables, and uncomfortable chairs. Overall, not a real dining room. It's not a cozy place. The people at the front desk moreover are not pleasant and not helpful. The rooms are average size, but there is a lot of noise on the street. The bulbs in the room are very dim and you cannot even read. The room has an uncomfortable configuration of furniture and the shower is very small and uncomfortable. I noticed that the floors were not properly cleaned each night and there was mold on the wall. I had a very unpleasant experience when I wanted to switch hotels, because I was not happy, and they informed me I would have to stay three additional nights. They said they had a 48 hour policy which was not written anywhere, and yet could not be varied. It was only when I asked a Spanish friend to help me out that they agreed that I could leave. What I would say is that they were arrogant, perhaps because I was a foreign person, although I could speak Spanish. I would never stay there again as I don't think I was treated well at all.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Avram K
Reviews.Content: My wife and i just stayed for three nights. The staff is friendly, knowledgeable, helpful and courteous. The location is quiet and it is an easy walk to most Prado, Retiro, shopping, the city center and the metro. The decor is artistically modern and comfortable. The breakfast buffet was just the right amount of food and choice. I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “I'd go back :-)”
Reviews.Author: Spainfor4
Reviews.Content: Lovely boutique hotel. Stayed on the 6th floor with Terrace which overlooked Plaza de Colon (in the distance). Room was was bigger than average hotels but not a lot of space between side of bed and wall but was fine, Bathroom spacious.There was a small kitchen which has fridge sink microwave and an espresso coffee machine which was lovely. Had a breakfast which was small buffet but very good. Staff were really friends and helpful. Would definately go b

Reviews.Title: “very nice, off the main road”
Reviews.Author: spud2424
Reviews.Content: Quite a few places to eat and shop near this hotel. Good location to hop on the metro or take a nice stroll to the Prado. Very helpful staff and safe car parking. The breakfast in the hotel is definitely not worth it. Very modern and clean hotel, not many rooms. Had a nice kitchenette area in the rooms which was convenient. The only downside was slightly choppy WiFi. We booked two rooms as a family of 4 so the reservation became a little pricey as well.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: Richardreynolds1
Reviews.Content: This is the sort of small hotel you hope to find but rarely do! Bedrooms and bathrooms well appointed. Very friendly and efficient staff. Wifi that functions. Close to all the smart shops and only a 10 minute walk or so from the Prado museum, Retiro park and other Madrid show stoppers. An ideal place for a short break - a place to explore from rather than to luxuriate in (not much F&B or spa etc). Maximum security too - the (quiet) neighbouring streets are full of police given the hotel's proximity to various ministries.

Reviews.Title: “Great 3 Days”
Reviews.Author: Ingersollian
Reviews.Content: Just finished a 3 day stay at ADR. Great value for your money. Exceptional service and a friendly smile. Rooms had a small kitchenette for a snack or meal. Overall a rating of 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Amador de Los Rios Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Silbery
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a week in Aug 2011. This is a really nice hotel for the price. Its a little out of the main tourist area so much quieter and away from all the trappings but still handy to everything especially all the museums along la Castellana - don't be afraid to jump on the buses that run along there either - they're fantastic, or about a 15 min walk to the heart of things past lots of non-tourist independant shopping and its close to the more upmarket shopping area of Serrano as well. The restaurant menu is pretty limited and a bit over priced but plenty of local places to eat nearby. I chose this hotel for the pool with thoughts of relaxing in the sun sitting around it. Unfortunately its in shade all day long and the water is freezing so that didn't happen. Theres so much to do in Madrid I didn't have time for that anyway. I was travelling alone (and I'm female) and I felt very comfortable walking back to the hotel late in the evenings. (I moved to a hotel near Tirso de Molina/La Latina stations to join a tour and was very uncomfortable walking there alone). Staff were friendly and helpful, the rooms are very clean and modern. Really enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel”
Reviews.Author: brissie
Reviews.Content: We had a room on the top floor - really enjoyed the outside terrace. Good size bathroom. The kitchenette was tiny but aqequate. The staff were very friendly and very helpful. We found the location to be perfect - very quiet (and secure!) but an easy walk to restaurants, transport etc. Would highly recommend to the leisure traveller and hope to return one day.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, NEW, Modern & Fresh!”
Reviews.Author: jpetry2
Reviews.Content: This was the first stop on our honeymoon. The hotel was recommended by friends of ours that are from Madrid. Spent 4 days here. The location is NEW, safe, quiet... super clean hotel & rooms, so warm welcoming and modern. The concierge was great, they booked us an amazing Flamenco show. Our room had an awesome balcony that has an automatic sun cover when the sun is too bright, a little kitchenette. For two people over 6' the rooms were definitely small but there was something charming about that. Also, we spent most of our time walking around the city (great location) or on the balcony enjoying some wine so we were not very high maintenance.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent cost benefit ratio”
Reviews.Author: HKFrizzo
Reviews.Content: Very good room, clean, spacious, with a kitchen embeded and a good shower. Fast connection free wi-fi. The location is excelent, in a quiet street, but still close to the city center and to the metro station. The only downside was the clerk that made the check in. He looked like very bored with his profession. But the rest of the time the clerks were friendly. I do recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What a find!”
Reviews.Author: SimonPSurrey
Reviews.Content: Stayed only for one night, excellent sums the hotel up, its not huge, but the rooms are immaculate, well sized and ideal for a couple or with a child) Large kingsize bed, writing desk, flat screen tv (though only could get about 6 channels - strange CNN only UK language) large bathroom, very good shower... air conditioned, kitchenette and stocked minibar. Its about 100 at the time of writing this review... in a nice way its good to keep this type of hotel under wraps.... but its a place id have no hesitation to recommend or stay at time and time again. Couple of other points... its well positioned in the city, its is by the "Ministry of the Interior" and armed police are patrolling 24/7 and for example I had a hire car & was stopped by the police... but mentioned I was staying in the hotel etc... so security is really high.... oh it has a car park also just under €20 per night to park. The hotel has a pool, so in the summer ideal to cool off.. Hope you enjoy it... there is nothing any reasonable person staying could moan about...

Reviews.Title: “Loved it very much !!”
Reviews.Author: DaniloVicky
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a very pleasant stay from September 21 till 25. It is beautiful, clean, safe and peaceful. The atmosphere of the hotel gives you a feeling of luxury and welcome. The room is large and has a very good maintained spacious bathroom, a small kitchenette with all you need to have a breakfast: even table cloth and macchiato to make a coffee. Everything is new. The location of the hotel is perfect- close to the city center in a luxury neighborhood, close to the metro, bus stop, a nice market and a supermarket just 10 minutes walk. The street is very quiet and safe, the sleep quality is perfect. The bed was large and very fine. Very good and not expensive restaurants are just around the corner. We had a very good time. You can rent a notebook for 6 EUR per day. It would be nice to have an internet point with Skype.

Reviews.Title: “Nice appart-hotel”
Reviews.Author: noghri
Reviews.Content: The Amador is known as the most design appart-hotel in Madrid, and this is true. Rooms are big and decorated in style. You can find everything you would expect from a good hotel room, from bath amenities to slippers, complimentary wifi and cd:dvd player. The kitchenette is handy, but rather small (2 dishes, 2 forks, 2 knifes, 2 glasses, that's it !). So good for breakfast, but don't expect cooking al your meals every day there. We were missing a spoon and some coffee cups, and the staff did directly bring additional ones upon our request. They also clean the dishes (which is nice !). The Amador is located a bit above he Madrid city center, but close enough to allow easy discovery of the city by foot. And two subway stations are close as well. The neighborhood of the hotel is über-quiet, as the hotel is located next to some kind of official building constantly under police surveillance. We also never encountered any other customers during our 5 nights stay... Good points : - location - room and decoration - sound isolation - friendly staff Can be improved - no coffee / thee making possibilities and tiny fridge full of mini-bar stuff (a pity in an appart-hotel !) -shower / bath rather dark (no lights) and not as "fresh" as the rest of the bathroom

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bardo71
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in AdeR hotel. The staff is very helpful and friendly. The location is good, very close to the Colon roundabout, Metro station and if you fancy walking it is around 25 to 30 mins to Plaza del Sol. We stayed one night in a standard room and two in a balcony one. I have the impression that the standard is in fact bigger, so I would recommend to got for this.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in central but quiet area”
Reviews.Author: Kolia
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel with only 29 rooms located in a secure and quiet area, just a few minutes walk from Plaza Colon and the metro station Colon. The hotel is not exactly in the touristic area but the location is better than being in Central Madrid. The museums are all within walking distance, as well as the best fashionable shopping area. The Plaza Mayor is about 30-40 minutes walking. Many of the buildings around the hotel belong to the Minitsry of the Interior, therefore the whole area is under permanent police control. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The rooms are modern, clear, clean, fresh and airy. The double bed is 180 cm wide. The mattress might seem a bit hard, but comfortable. As this is an aparthotel, every room is equipped with a small kitchen with electric cooker, microwave oven, small fridge, sink and dishes. The bathroom is quite big, modern, with a bidet. All the appliances and the taps are in a very good condition. The shower is very powerful. I would definitely recommend this small luxurious hotel in the heart of Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: JJ5605
Reviews.Content: The staff all were very friendly, helpful and spoke English. They were wonderful with helping with directions or recommendations. The lobby and room were well appointed and of a good size, especially for Europe. The bathroom was modern and spacious. Everything was very clean. You have a mini kitchen behind doors, that we did not use, but was nice in case you did want to cook a meal. Our room overlooked the street, but it is a quiet one to begin with and then they have a metal blind that lowers for night time to block out any additional noise. The bed was very hard, as other people have mentioned, but neither my husband nor myself woke up with any aches, so I guess it was okay. The only thing I was disappointed with, was there are only a few restaurants nearby. You really aren't in "the heart" of town, but the metro is right nearby. Also, the Dept. of Interior is on the same street and there are always police out in the street, so it is VERY safe!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for a short stay in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: EllaMLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed for just one night around Easter. Very good hotel and good value for money. We arrived just after midday exhausted by a horrible early-mornign flight from London and had a nice welcome from staff, clean and spacious room, very nice bathroom - clean and modern. The bed is quite firm but comfortable. I love hotels with ipod docking stations and bidets - this one has both :) On arrival we ordered a room service before resting a bit; the food was simple yet decent and pricing for food and wine was very reasonable (as well as for mini-bar beverage). The hotel is not exactly in the touristic area but we walked everywhere regardless of the rainy and chilly weather. It's about 30-40 mins walk to Plaza Mayor but it's quite a nice walk if it does not rain. When we travel to Madrid next time, we'll be booking Amador de los Rios again.

Reviews.Title: “just great for a city break”
Reviews.Author: LondonWiggies
Reviews.Content: decent location short cheap taxi or easy few stops on the metro from the centre. very good rooms with great showers, decent breakfast. pool only gets sun in middle of day because it's on ground floor surrounded by tall buildings, worth using though. room 604 was top floor and got lovely sunshine on its balcony from about 4 till 8 30 when we stayed. we really liked it and Madrid is party central and great fun for a long weekend

Reviews.Title: “Small nice hotel and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: cohoreqs
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 2 nights and were very positively surprised with the quality and staff. Rooms are quite small, but well thought to maximise comfort. Interiors are modern and the surrounding area is very quiet while located within walking distance to Madrid's major sites. Perfect hotel for a short stay, but there is also a small annex-kitchen for travellers wishing to stay longer.

Reviews.Title: “Superb. A perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ConstantineG
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is not part of a chain. The staff are delightful, the rooms are spotless, and mine, although I was told that they are all more or less the same, did not have the solarium or terrace others have quoted. Free wi-fi (something I feel very strongly about, and I refuse to stay in a hotel that charges), cooking facilities, dvd player, mp3 player dock and tv are all in the spacious room. The shower is powerful, but if you like to languish in a bath (in my room at least) you will be disappointed, as the bath is small. Plenty of room for two to stand up in, though! Perhaps as a result of the modernisation, there is now a very good breakfast buffet in the bar area downstairs or by the small pool. What really makes it is the location, which couldn't be more central, near the metro and buses, an easy walk to the Prado for example, and yet very quiet as the small street also houses the Ministry of the Interior, so there is no traffic and a lot of protection! There is also a garage, although I don't know the charges. I cannot recommend this charming, friendly hotel highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem......”
Reviews.Author: Bowgreave
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely little hotel up a side street in central Madrid. Very convenient for the business district and the embassies, it is hard to fault if you like the studio apartment set-up, which we do. A one-change Metro trip from the airport, it offers 3m sq balconies, full mini-kitchens, good facilities and has that extra something about it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: david_from_Paris
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotel I have ever been in Madrid, considering its great location, very central near Chueca area and all tube stations. Rooms are modern and very nice decorated, clean, good bed. They have no dining or breakfast room but you get it in your own bedroom for a very reasonable price, ie around 5€ per person. Definitely a must!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel and area - would recommend it to anyone”
Reviews.Author: ttips
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights during the beginning of Sept 2007. This was a great boutique hotel to stay in while in Madrid. The staff was excellent. The accommodations were super, even starting with the slippers left for you in the room as well as the mini - kitchenette. We had a room with 2 double beds which was narrow but we had plenty of room for the stay. It was very quiet in the room. As a bonus it was in an area in Salamanca near government buildings so for added safety there were civil guards at all the corners to the street overseeing the government buildings. The location was also great, on a quiet street with many sights in walking distance - the Prado, Thyssen B, Retiro Park, Plaza Colon and Metro station. Even Plaza Mayor was in walking distance or a short metro ride. We would easily stay here again and recommend it to all of our friends.

Reviews.Title: “nice location but...”
Reviews.Author: fbob454
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an excellent location but it was not what I expected. First, some of the staff were unkind and the manager in particular was a very rude, unhelpful and nasty person, something unsual at the Espahotel chain. The rooms are nicely decorated, and especially the bathroom. However, rooms are pretty small and surely not big enough for two people (a double room may be OK for one person only). The room has a kitchenette, but next to the wardrobe, which is not very practical. The tiny sitting area is compact too. The hotel itself does not have any facility (I saw a dirty and empty swimming pool which did not seem to be in use). There is no wi-fi either, so I guess it is not ideal for business stays. Overall, the hotel has a good location but it is not worth the price. There are much better choices in Madrid.
